page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: Because of the lower altitude, greater shelter from winds and gentler slopes, sheep farming here gives way to mixed farming, usually combining stock rear -ing with a small amount of arable, mainly to provide winter feed for the animals. There are several milking herds here. Despite the altitude and comparatively boisterous climate,there have been recent attempts to diversify into such activities as soft-fruit growing.Two farms have offered pick-your-own strawberries during the last few years, but it remains to be seen whether these ventures have survived the cool,wet summer of 1985.
